name: ARA Ai Avatar v1.9.2 - Coach Joe

parameters.command:
=# knobs
TOP_H=608
GAP=1
PUSH=0
CROP_TOP={{ $('Avatar List').item.json.TopCrop }}
EXTRA_CROP=0

# compute the bottom height
BOTTOM_H=$((1920 - (TOP_H + GAP + PUSH) - EXTRA_CROP))
BOT_Y=$((TOP_H + GAP + PUSH))

ffmpeg -y \
-i "/videos/{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}_xvideo.mp4" \
-i "/videos/{{ $json.id }}_clone.mp4" \
-filter_complex "
color=c=black:size=1080x1920:d=360[bg];
[0:v]scale=1080:${TOP_H}:flags=bicubic[top];
[1:v]scale=1080:-2[vs];
[vs]crop=w=1080:h=${BOTTOM_H}:x=0:y=${CROP_TOP}[bot];
[bg][top]overlay=x=0:y=0[tmp];
[tmp][bot]overlay=x=0:y=${BOT_Y}[v];
[1:a]volume=1.5[a]
" \
-map "[v]" -map "[a]" \
-t "$(ffprobe -v error -show_entries format=duration -of default=noprint_wrappers=1:nokey=1 "/videos/{{ $json.id }}_clone.mp4")" \
-c:v libx264 -pix_fmt yuv420p -crf 18 -preset veryfast \
-c:a aac -movflags +faststart \
/videos/{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}_output_vertical.mp4

values.content:
=You are a caption generator that returns ONLY a single valid JSON object with these keys:
"Instagram caption", "Facebook caption", "Twitter caption", "TikTok caption", "YouTube short caption", "YouTube short title", "LinkedIn caption", "Bluesky caption", "Threads caption", "Pinterest caption".

Goal
Create concise, platform-tailored captions for a short-form video. The user will provide a YouTube or short-form script as input. Extract the hook, the core insight/benefit, 1 to 2 concrete specifics, and a clear soft CTA. Keep everything punchy because the video carries most context.

Critical content rule

The captions MUST reflect the actual topic of the provided video_script.

Do NOT inject or mention any product, brand, service, person, or link unless it is explicitly present or strongly implied in the video_script.

If the script is about ARA or ARA AI Solution, write captions about that. If the script is not about ARA, do not force ARA into captions.

Inputs you will receive

video_script: the full script or outline

topic or product: optional

target_audience: optional

desired_CTA: optional

hashtags_or_keywords: optional

tone: optional (default calm, strategic, mentor-like)

Global rules

Output JSON only. No extra text, no markdown, no comments.

Do not include newline characters inside any value unless the platform rules below explicitly allow line breaks.

Never fabricate facts. Derive claims from the video_script.

Keep captions distinct across platforms. No copy-paste.

Prefer principle-based framing over instructional phrasing.

Prefer diagnostic or consequence-based language over instructional phrases like ‚Äúshould‚Äù or ‚Äúmust.‚Äù

Prefer 1 emoji max where appropriate; if tone is professional, use zero.

Avoid motivational phrases like ‚Äúfocus beats chaos,‚Äù ‚Äúwatch it soar,‚Äù or generic inspiration language.

Use 1 to 3 short hashtags max when appropriate. Avoid spammy blocks of tags.

Avoid platform-specific handles unless provided.

Language: match the language of the video_script.

No external links in captions (v01). If a link is present in inputs, you may reference ‚Äúlink in bio‚Äù but do not paste URLs.

Voice / tone guidance

Default voice: calm authority + warm mentor.

No hype, no aggressive selling, no exaggerated claims.

Aim for clarity, insight, and quiet confidence.

Platform styles and constraints


Instagram caption

Aim 80 to 120 characters.

One short hook, one benefit/insight, soft CTA.

Up to 2 hashtags at the end.

Optional single emoji near the start.

No links.


Facebook caption

Aim 100 to 160 characters.

Friendly, clear, mentor-like. One sentence plus CTA.

Add 1 to 2 hashtags only if natural.

No links.


Twitter caption

Aim 80 to 120 characters for scannability.

Tight hook + 1 key detail/insight + short CTA.

Max 2 hashtags. Avoid emojis unless the tone is informal.

No links.


TikTok caption

Aim 60 to 100 characters.

Open with a counterintuitive, tension-based, or consequence-driven statement in under 12 words.

Avoid starting with ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù or summarizing the topic.

Follow with a short curiosity CTA such as ‚ÄúWatch this.‚Äù or ‚ÄúWatch till the end.‚Äù

Up to 3 short, relevant hashtags.

No links.

Avoid hype emojis unless strongly aligned with tone.


YouTube short caption

Aim 100 to 150 characters.

Clarify the value viewers get in one line. One CTA to subscribe/follow or try the tip.

1 to 2 hashtags max.

No links.


YouTube short title

Aim 40 to 60 characters.

Lead with outcome or transformation. Include a power verb.

No brackets clickbait. No punctuation at the end unless it is a question.


LinkedIn caption

Aim 140 to 200 characters.

Professional, insight-led, one specific takeaway from the script, and a light CTA to comment or reflect.

No emojis unless the industry is casual. No hashtags unless 1 highly relevant tag adds value.

No links.


Bluesky caption

Aim 80 to 120 characters.

Conversational and slightly thoughtful/tech-savvy.

1 to 2 hashtags max. No emojis unless tone is casual.

Encourage replies with a question or curiosity.

No links.


Threads caption

Aim 80 to 120 characters.

More casual, community vibe. Feel like talking to friends but still smart.

1 emoji max, if it feels natural.

1 to 2 hashtags max.

No links.


Pinterest caption

Aim 100 to 150 characters.

Inspire curiosity or promise a benefit.

Can include 1 to 2 hashtags for search relevance.

No emojis unless they fit a creative or lifestyle tone.

No links.


Content extraction from video_script

Belief Shift: identify the underlying assumption most people get wrong, or the deeper principle behind the advice.

Insight: extract the core strategic lesson (not just the topic summary).

Reframe the idea using cause-and-effect logic or consequence-based reasoning instead of slogans.

Frame insights as patterns observed in real-world business rather than general advice.

Specific: include one practical example, step, or concrete element if available.

CTA: use a soft, reflective action phrase (e.g., ‚ÄúThink about it.‚Äù ‚ÄúTry this.‚Äù ‚ÄúAgree?‚Äù ‚ÄúSave this.‚Äù ‚ÄúFollow for more systems thinking.‚Äù).

Important:
Do not merely summarize the script.
Translate the idea into a clear principle or strategic insight.


Formatting rules

Escape any internal quotes as needed to keep valid JSON.

Do not exceed each platform‚Äôs character targets.

If an input is missing, make the best safe assumption. Do not leave fields empty.

Return format (example keys only; values must be generated from the provided script):
{
"Instagram caption": "...",
"Facebook caption": "...",
"Twitter caption": "...",
"TikTok caption": "...",
"YouTube short caption": "...",
"YouTube short title": "...",
"LinkedIn caption": "...",
"Bluesky caption": "...",
"Threads caption": "...",
"Pinterest caption": "..."
}

parameters.url: =https://api.apify.com/v2/actor-tasks/{{ $('‚öôÔ∏è Setup').item.json['Apify Video Downloader URN'] }}/run-sync-get-dataset-items?token={{ $('‚öôÔ∏è Setup').item.json['Apify API Token'] }}

parameters.command: =ffmpeg -y -ss 0 -t 3 -i "{{ $('Write Voice Full1').item.json.fileName }}" -acodec copy "/videos/{{ $('(‚≠ê Create) a record').item.json.id }}3s_voice.mp3"

=#!/bin/sh
set -eu -o pipefail

RID="{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}"
IN_RAW="${RID}_xvideo_9x16.mp4"
FIRST_3="${RID}_output_vertical.mp4"
MUSIC_RAW="${RID}_music.mp3"

OUT="/videos/${RID}_video_only.mp4"

# Resolve absolute paths
case "$IN_RAW"    in /*) IN="$IN_RAW"     ;; *) IN="/videos/$IN_RAW"     ;; esac
case "$FIRST_3"   in /*) F3="$FIRST_3"    ;; *) F3="/videos/$FIRST_3"    ;; esac
case "$MUSIC_RAW" in /*) MUSIC="$MUSIC_RAW";; *) MUSIC="/videos/$MUSIC_RAW";; esac

# Sanity checks
[ -f "$IN" ]    || { echo "ERROR: Input video not found: $IN" >&2; exit 1; }
[ -f "$F3" ]    || { echo "ERROR: Overlay not found: $F3" >&2; exit 1; }
[ -f "$MUSIC" ] || { echo "ERROR: Music not found: $MUSIC" >&2; exit 1; }

rm -f -- "$OUT" || true

# Explanation:
# - Overlay fades out at 2.5s (0.5s crossfade).
# - Voice track from IN is boosted 1.5x louder.
# - Music stays at 0.1 volume.
# - Overlay scales up and centers.

ffmpeg -hide_banner -loglevel error -y -nostdin -threads 2 \
  -i "$IN" \
  -i "$F3" \
  -i "$MUSIC" \
  -filter_complex "
    [1:v]trim=0:3,setpts=PTS-STARTPTS,scale=iw*1:-1,fade=t=out:st=2.5:d=0.5:alpha=1[overlayfit]; \
    [0:v]setpts=PTS-STARTPTS[base]; \
    [base][overlayfit]overlay=(W-w)/2:(H-h)/2:enable='between(t,0,3)'[vout]; \
    [0:a]volume=1.25[a0]; \
    [2:a]volume=0.28[a2]; \
    [a0][a2]amix=inputs=2:duration=first:dropout_transition=3[aout]
  " \
  -map "[vout]" -map "[aout]" \
  -c:v libx264 -preset veryfast -crf 18 -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  -c:a aac -b:a 192k \
  -movflags +faststart \
  "$OUT"

printf '{"output":"%s"}' "$OUT"

=#!/bin/sh
set -eu

RID="{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}"

INPUT="/videos/${RID}_xvideo.mp4"
VOICE="/videos/${RID}_voice_full.mp3"
OUTPUT="/videos/${RID}_xvideo_9x16.mp4"

ffmpeg -y \
  -i "$INPUT" \
  -i "$VOICE" \
  -filter_complex "\
    color=c=black:s=1080x1920:d=999[bg]; \
    [0:v]scale=1080:-1[vid]; \
    [bg][vid]overlay=(W-w)/2:(H-h)/2:eval=init,format=yuv420p[v]" \
  -map "[v]" -map 1:a \
  -c:v libx264 -c:a aac -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  -shortest -movflags +faststart "$OUTPUT"

printf '{\"output\":\"%s\"}' \"$OUTPUT\"

=#!/bin/sh
set -eu

IN="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}_video_only.mp4"
SUBS="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}_subtitles.ass"
OUT="/videos/{{ $('Update Voice').item.json.id }}_output.mp4"

ffmpeg -y -i "$IN" -vf "subtitles='$SUBS'" -c:v libx264 -c:a copy "$OUT"

printf '{"output":"%s"}' "$OUT"

values.content:
=You are a viral short-form video scriptwriter for YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, Facebook Reels, and TikTok.

‚Ä¢ Read the target length (seconds) and compute WORD_BUDGET = floor(seconds * WPS). Default WPS = {{ $json.wps || 2.4 }} .
‚Ä¢ Output one script only, no pre/post text.
‚Ä¢ Never exceed WORD_BUDGET words. If your draft is longer, compress before replying.
‚Ä¢ 6th-grade reading level.
‚Ä¢ First sentence = announcement of exactly what happened.
‚Ä¢ 2nd sentence starts the details; include specific facts from the inspiration.
‚Ä¢ End with: one powerful shocking closing sentence.

Platform Retention Optimization

‚Ä¢ The first 6‚Äì8 words must create urgency or tension.
‚Ä¢ Use short, punchy sentences (8‚Äì14 words preferred).
‚Ä¢ Avoid long flowing paragraphs. Break ideas into strong beats.
‚Ä¢ The first 3 seconds must feel fast and decisive.
‚Ä¢ No complex clauses or difficult phrasing.
‚Ä¢ Write for speech ‚Äî it must sound smooth when spoken aloud.
‚Ä¢ Use natural rhythm variation but avoid dramatic punctuation or exaggerated formatting.

Write primarily in English, but naturally blend in short and simple Malay words or phrases where appropriate for emphasis, relatability, or emotional impact. The Malay words must feel organic and conversational (e.g., ‚Äúsebenarnya‚Äù, ‚Äúbayangkan‚Äù, ‚Äúramai orang tak sedar‚Äù, ‚Äúbetul ke?‚Äù, ‚Äúitu masalahnya‚Äù, ‚Äúdisiplin tu susah‚Äù, ‚Äúsenang cerita‚Äù). Do not overuse Malay. Do not translate full sentences. Keep it subtle and natural like how Malaysians casually mix English and Malay.

If the topic naturally relates to follow-ups, reminders, or missed opportunities, you may include a short and subtle reference (one sentence maximum) that I built and personally use a smart reminder assistant called Ara inside WhatsApp. The mention must feel natural, not promotional, not a call-to-action, and must blend seamlessly into the narrative. Do not force it if it feels unrelated.

The script must stay within ¬±1 word of (seconds √ó WPS).

=find out more information about: 
{{ $('HTTP Apify1').item.json.text }}

Posted by {{ $json.author.name }} on x. 

They may have annoucned something or an update?
I want you to find as many facts and information about it.

Come back with at least 500 words

value.Name: ={{ $json.author.userName }}
value.Ratio:
={{
(() => {
  const r =
    $json.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.retweet?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweet?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweet?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.retweeted_status?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweeted_status?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.retweeted_status?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quote?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quoted_status?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_status?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_status?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.quoted_tweet?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quoted_tweet?.extended_entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

    || $json.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.extendedEntities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio
    || $json.quote?.entities?.media?.[0]?.video_info?.aspect_ratio

  // Clean array output
  return Array.isArray(r) ? `[${r.join(',')}]` : r;
})()
}}
